item.title: Topic classification of Yahoo Answers using deep learning models
item.description: Classification of Yahoo Answers Introduction The goal of this project is to classify Yahoo! Answers posts into their respective topics. We use a dataset provided by Huggingface, which includes 2 million Yahoo! Answers posts categorized into ten topics. We select three topics - Health, Science & Mathematics, and Society & Culture - and sample 100,000 posts from the dataset for training and testing. We apply several models to the task of classification, including rule-based models, traditional machine learning models, and deep learning models.

item.title: Probability of death and length of stay using MIMIC dataset
item.description: Introduction The following project has two objectives: Predict the probability of death of a patient that is entering an ICU (Intensive Care Unit) using K-Nearest Neighbors (KNN) and Support Vector Machine (SVM) models. Predict the length of stay (in days) of a patient that is entering an ICU using decision tree, ensembles and neural networks models. Dataset description The dataset comes from MIMIC project (https://mimic.physionet.org/). MIMIC-III (Medical Information Mart for Intensive Care III) is a large, freely-available database comprising deidentified health-related data associated with over forty thousand patients who stayed in critical care units of the Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center between 2001 and 2012.

item.title: Sentiment Analysis for Monetary Policy Predictions
item.description: This project highlights the scope for using text data from central bank statements to improve predictions about policy rates. item.title: About
item.description: My name is Vicente Lisboa, and I am a Spanish/Chilean national with a passion for data analysis, project management and sports. With a Industrial Engineering degree from the Pontifical Catholic University of Chile, I have gained experience in various roles, ranging from data analyst for the Ministry of Health to project manager at Shift SpA. In my recent role at the Ministry of Health, I designed management control mechanisms and capitalized on opportunities of strategic processes in the context of the Sars-Cov-2 pandemic.
